The claim made by State Sen: Bryce Reeves regarding the ability of a single mom in Richmond to make almost $50,000 a year on public assistance.
The source of the claim: which is a report by the Virginia Department of Social Services that examines the "road to self-sufficiency" for a fictitious Richmond mom with two children.
The specific types of public assistance: including welfare, Women Infants and Children food basket, child care assistance, school lunch, and a housing voucher.
The inclusion of potential medical benef: such as Medicaid for the mom and FAMIS Plus for the children, although the exact cost of these benefits is uncertain.
